perturbation.original_text: As a condition to the New Directors' appointment to the Board and any subsequent nomination for election as a director at any future Company annual meeting of stockholders, he or she must provide any information required to be disclosed in a proxy statement or other filing under applicable law, stock exchange rules or listing standards.
perturbation.changed_text: As a condition to the New Directors' appointment to the Board and any subsequent nomination for election as a director at any future Company annual meeting of stockholders, he or she should endeavor to provide information required to be disclosed in a proxy statement or other filing under applicable law, stock exchange rules or listing standards to the best of their ability.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'must provide' to 'should endeavor to provide to the best of their ability' weakens the obligation to disclose required information, introducing ambiguity about the level of effort and completeness expected. This contradicts SEC regulations requiring full and accurate disclosure in proxy statements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: SEC regulations regarding proxy statements and disclosure requirements

perturbation.original_text: The MG Capital Parties shall comply, and shall cause each of their Affiliates and Associates (as hereinafter defined) to comply with the terms of this Agreement and shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by any such Affiliate or Associate.
perturbation.changed_text: The MG Capital Parties shall generally seek to comply with the terms of this Agreement, and will encourage their Affiliates and Associates (as hereinafter defined) to do the same. The MG Capital Parties' responsibility for any breach of this Agreement by any such Affiliate or Associate shall be limited to reasonable efforts to ensure compliance.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall comply' with 'shall generally seek to comply' and limiting responsibility to 'reasonable efforts' creates ambiguity and weakens the legally binding nature of the clause. This contradicts general contract law principles which require strict adherence to agreed terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding adherence to contract terms

perturbation.original_text: Each of the Parties covenants and agrees that, during the Standstill Period, neither Party nor any of its subsidiaries, Affiliates, successors, assigns, principals, partners, members, general partners, officers, key employees or directors (collectively, "Representatives"), shall in any way, directly or indirectly, in any capacity or manner, whether written or oral, electronically or otherwise (including, without limitation, in a television, radio, internet, newspaper, magazine interview, or otherwise through the press, media, analysts or other persons or in any document or report filed with the SEC), publicly disparage, impugn, make ad hominem attacks on or otherwise defame or slander or make, express, transmit, speak, write, verbalize or otherwise publicly communicate in any way (or cause, further, assist, solicit, encourage, support or participate in any of the foregoing), any public communication or statement of any kind, whether verbal, in writing, electronically transferred or otherwise, that might reasonably be construed to be disparage, derogate or impugn, the other Party or such other Party's Representatives (including any current officer or director of a Party or a Parties' subsidiaries who no longer serves in such capacity following the execution of this Agreement), employees, stockholders (solely in their capacity as stockholders of the applicable Party), or any of their businesses, products or services, in any manner that would reasonably be expected to damage the business, or reputation of the other Party or of its Representatives (including former officers and directors), directors (or former directors), employees, stockholders (solely in their capacity as stockholders of the applicable Party); provided that, with respect to any litigation, arbitration or other proceeding between the Parties, nothing in this Section 5 shall prevent either Party from disclosing any facts or circumstances with respect to any such litigation, arbitration or other proceeding.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Parties will endeavor, within reason, during the Standstill Period, to ensure that neither Party nor its direct representatives publicly disparage the other Party or its direct representatives in a manner intentionally designed to cause material harm to the business or reputation of the other Party, provided that nothing shall prevent either party from disclosing facts and circumstances related to any litigation. Each party will not be held liable for statements made by parties that are not their direct representatives.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prohibits disparagement of the other party and their representatives. The modification weakens this clause by adding 'endeavor, within reason' and restricting liability to direct representatives, thereby creating ambiguity about the level of effort required to prevent disparagement and excludes liability for any public statement from the party's indirect representatives. This might contradict the intended scope of protection against reputational harm and the fiduciary duties expected of parties bound by the agreement by potentially allowing indirect disparagement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Fiduciary duty and potential violation of defamation laws based on the interpretation of 'intentional design' and 'material harm'
